revised_title: An Unusual Frost in June: Effects on Plants and the Environment
tldr: In a letter to Sir Joseph Banks, Rev. Sir John Cullum describes a rare frost that occurred on June 23, 1783. The frost caused damage to crops and plants, with the barley, oats, and larch being particularly affected. The author also notes the unusual cold weather leading up to the frost and its aftermath. This event highlights the impact of extreme weather on the environment and agriculture.
